newsitem.title: FRANCE: New wave of rain sweeps France after dry spell.
newsitem.headline: New wave of rain sweeps France after dry spell.

text.p: A new wave of rain and showers swept across France on Sunday but forecasters said it was insufficient to revive crops after a three-month dry spell.

Meteo France estimated about 10 mm had fallen in most areas of France over the weekend, with another 5-10 mm forecast for Monday. From mid-week, showers were expected to die out with a return to dry, sunny weather.
"These are good rains but it's not enough for the farmers," a forecaster at Meteo France said. "They need about 10 times these amounts to be reassured."

A dry spell in much of northwest Europe has helped drive world wheat prices to 1997 highs around $4.25 per bushel in Chicago futures. The European Union imposed a tax on Thursday to curb wheat exports and thereby keep a lid on internal prices.
